TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ServiceDescriptionReflector extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a managed way of dynamically viewing, creating or invoking types supported by an XML Web service.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Reflect (Type type, string url);
.method public hidebysig instance void Reflect(class System.Type type, string url) cil managed

Docs.param: The of the class or interface to reflect.
The address (URL) of the XML Web service.
Docs.summary: Creates a including the specified for the XML Web service at the specified URL.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method examines the metadata for the XML Web service at the specified URL. If the specified <xref:System.Type> is not supported, it modifies the Web Services Description Language (WSDL) file corresponding to the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription> describing the XML Web service, in order to include that type.
For more information about Web Services Description Language (WSDL), see the specification at http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl/.

Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the associated with the XML Web service.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is initialized with a <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A> of zero. Any members must be explicitly added using the collection's <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemas.Add%2A> method.
For more information about Web Services Description Language (WSDL), see the specification at http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl/.

Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the associated with the XML Web service.
Docs.value: A reference to the associated with the XML Web service.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is initialized with a <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A> of zero. Any members must be explicitly added using the collection's <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionCollection.Add%2A> method.
For more information about Web Services Description Language (WSDL), see the specification at http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl/.
